page.title: 13A visit to hospital
page.content: I went into the John Radcliffe hospital in Oxford. I went in to have the cyst under my tongue taken off. I had first noticed the cyst when I was cleaning my teeth, it didn't really hurt unless I touched it. It looked like a big bubble. My hospital room had a bed, a bedside cupboard, a basin and a wardrobe. My mum stayed in the next room for the night. The next morning at 8.30 a.m. they put a funny cloak on me and took me to the operating theatre. They put a mask in front of my mouth,it smelled like mint. When I woke up I was back in my room. My tongue was sore and hurt. There were four big stitches where the bubble used to be. Later on I had bowl of tomato soup and a mousse. All the family came to collect me in the evening. When I got home I had some more soup with some bread, some cereal and a tomato, I was very hungry!
